archimate:Requirement.name: 4.51.2 External network design controls
archimate:Requirement.documentation: Information systems and networks accessible by external connections should be designed to: * use an agreed set of security controls for information formats and communications protocols * conceal computer or network names and topologies from external parties (e.g. by using dual or split network di-rectories/name servers) * protect sensitive information stored on information systems and transmitted to external party locations (e.g. using encryption).
